intro: Cucubalus fruticulosus, commonly known as the hairy bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated fruits that resemble small bladders, which contain seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
